alert.note: Alert for Central Sacramento Valley including Glenn, Colusa, Yuba, Northern Sutter, Butte County Below 1000 Ft; Eastern Mendocino NF; Northern Sacramento Valley to Southern Tehama County Line Below 1000 Ft; Southeast Edge Shasta, Trinity NF and Western Portions of Tehama, Glenn RU; Southern Sacramento Valley In Yolo, Sacramento, Far Western Placer, Southern Sutter and Solano County Below 1000 Ft - Excludes the Delta (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 29 at 9:08AM PDT until August 30 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 PM PDT WEDNESDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR FIRE ZONES 215, 216, 217, 263, AND 279... The National Weather Service in Sacramento has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low humidity, which is in effect from 11 PM this evening to 8 PM PDT Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Winds...Northerly wind 15 to 25 mph with gusts 30 to 35 mph. * Humidity...Tuesday night: poor overnight humidity recoveries of 30 to 45 percent. Wednesday afternoon: minimum humidity of 8 to 20 percent. * Highest Threat...West side of the Sacramento Valley, mainly along and west of Interstate 5. * Impacts...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
